knimeNode.name: Network Creator
knimeNode.shortDescription: Using JUNG, this node creates a network cell for the input data correlated above a chosen threshold for each target variable.

fullDescription.intro:
Builds a network, one edge for each row, consisting of three sets of user-specified columns to describe:
the source node. A node has a name (a unique ID is preferred) and any other columns to describe it. This annotation data will be saved with the network and loaded as needed.
the destination node. Like the source node this may be annotated with arbitrary columns. But a given column should not be used for both ie. specific to a particular node!
the connection (edge) between them. This may also be annotated and optionally a distance associated with the connection
For instance, using this node after a Correlation Calculator can give a network of correlations which may provide biological insight. The network can be saved in GraphML format or opened in a visualisation program like Gephi or Cytoscape. For now, only graphs with a single edge between source and destination are supported: an error will be thrown if this constraint is violated. This means you must eliminate redundancy before using this node eg. via GroupBy (First).
fullDescription.option: In this tab you may configure how table row colours are assigned to the view: used to colour nodes or edges. Show edge distance can be used to display the correlation values on the path between the two nodes (can create a cluttered graph). Paint edges as gradient "fades" the edges near nodes which can be somewhat neater. Missing values will be ignored.

Here you need to select the column which provides the names for the source nodes. If you want a timecourse bar chart to be displayed, select the list of values column here. Other annotations for the source nodes ONLY can be added also. Missing values will be ignored.
Similar options as per source nodes

Specify the distance (if any is computed) for the edge. This does not influence the layout as it is for visualisation only. Columns describing the edge can also be added here. Missing values will be ignored.

ports.inPort: One column should contain the source node (eg. gene or protein name), and another column the destination.
ports.outPort: A (small) table with only a network name and network graph output

views.view: Display the graph with edge lengths preportional to the chosen distance column.
